intro: Dioscorea flabellispina, commonly known as the fan-leaf yam, is a climbing vine belonging to the family Dioscoreaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its palmately divided, fan-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by edible tuberous roots that are used in traditional cuisine. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and herbal practices.
